intro: Oldenlandia sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and the leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy. It is adapted to thrive in humid, warm climates and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
